ğŸ“– Vol 2: Etiquette of Eating
And in the Quran there is an indication regarding presenting fruit first in His saying, the Exalted: 'And fruit of what they choose' then He said: 'And flesh of fowl of what they desire.' Then the best thing to present after the fruit is meat and tharid (bread soaked in broth), for he (peace and blessings be upon him) said: 'The excellence of Aisha over women is like the excellence of tharid over all other foods.' If sweetness is gathered to it afterward, then the good things have been gathered. And it indicates the attainment of honor through meat, His saying, the Exalted, regarding the guests of Ibrahim when he presented the roasted calf, meaning the roasted one, which is that which is excellently cooked, and it is one meaning of honor, I mean presenting meat. And He, the Exalted, said in describing the good things: 'And We sent down upon you the manna and the quails.' The manna is honey and the quails are meat. It is called salwa (quail) because one consoles oneself with it from all other dishes, and nothing else takes its place. And for that reason he (peace and blessings be upon him) said: 'The master of dishes is meat.' Then He said after mentioning the manna and the quails: 'Eat of the good things We have provided for you.' So meat and sweetness are from the good things.
